Course Description: THE COST AND MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING COURSE WILL COVER MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING AS PART OF THE INFORMATION MANAGERS USE FOR PLANNING AND CONTROLLING OPERATIONS. IT PREPARES STUDENTS TO CONSIDER COST BEHAVIOR AND EMPLOY VARIOUS COST METHODS. JOB ORDER COSTING, PROCESS COSTING, AND ACTIVITY-BASED COSTING METHODS WILL BE COVERED, ALONG WITH COST-BENEFIT ANALYSIS, STANDARD COSTING, VARIANCE ANALYSIS, AND COST REPORTING.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
THIS COURSE COVERS THE FOLLOWING COMPETENCIES: 
THE GRADUATE PERFORMS COSTBENEFIT ANALYSES FOR DECISION MAKING. 
THE GRADUATE APPLIES APPROPRIATE COST METHODS TO VARIOUS PRODUCTION SCENARIOS IN ORDER TO ACCURATELY ACCOUNT FOR COSTS OF A PRODUCT OR SERVICE. 
THE GRADUATE PREPARES VARIOUS FORMS OF OPERATING BUDGETS, INCLUDING A FLEXIBLE BUDGET SYSTEM FOR PLANNING AND EVALUATING THE PERFORMANCE OF BUSINESS SEGMENTS.
Textbook(s): INTRODUCTION TO MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING. GARRISON, NOREEN AND BREWER. ISBN 978-0078025792
